translation.en: [narrator Donald Black] The story of my young friends and I

translation.en: is really the story of a man named...
-Kevin Eastman. -And Peter Laird and I am the...
-...co-creator... -...of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.
♪ Teenage... ♪
[DB] Eastman and Laird,
two names synonymous with...
Turtle power. Hey!
That's the dumbest idea I've ever seen.
[DB] The unbelievable rise of Turtlemania
flipped the toy industry on its back.
[Karl Aaronian] We sold 100 million units
just in 1990. [cash register rings]
The summer of Turtlemania.
Go Ninja, go Ninja, go!
[DB] But this billion dollar industry mutated
translation.ko: 하지만 이 수십억 달러 규모 산업은 여기 사활을 건 홍콩 인형 회사의 제품으로부터 돌연변이를 일으켰죠

translation.en: from a Hong Kong dollmaker who put it all on the line.
translation.ko: 여기 사활을 건 홍콩 인형 회사의 제품으로부터 돌연변이를 일으켰죠

translation.en: I got down on my hands and knees and begged them to do this license.
translation.ko: 전 무릎을 꿇고 라이선스를 사달라고 빌었죠

translation.en: [DB] And this self-published comic
went from the dark and dingy shadows of the sewer...
It's too goofy, too stupid.
-It's dopey. -Oops!
[DB] ...to the spotlight of popular culture.
The biggest indie film of all time.
[DB] But this mega-hit toy line...
translation.ko: 하지만 이 대박 난 장난감 제품군은...

translation.en: The deal was 60 million dollars.
[DB] ...is really a love story of two creators...
It was love at first sight. [DB] ...that splintered into an enduring feud.
The betrayal of an idea that we had both shared.
[DB] This is the tale... -Is that their penis? -[snips]
[DB] ...of the slow and steady rise
of the most unique and surprising toy line ever made.
translation.ko: 장난감 제품군의 느리고 지속적인 성장에 관한 이야기죠

translation.en: -"Teenage Mutant Ninja" what? -[laughs]
These, right here, are the toys that made us.
translation.ko: - 이것은... - 이건 바로... '토이 - 우리가 사랑한 장난감들'입니다

translation.en: ♪ The continuing series about the toys that we all know ♪
translation.ko: 우리 모두가 아는 장난감에 관한 이어지는 다큐멘터리 시리즈예요

translation.en: ♪ Plastic creations that last for generations ♪
♪ And we still cannot let go ♪
♪ Little molded figures that gave us big dreams ♪
translation.ko: 우리에게 큰 꿈을 심어준 틀에서 만들어낸 작은 피겨들

translation.en: ♪ We'll go back in time and behind the scenes ♪
♪ It's The Toys That Made Us ♪
♪ Toys That Made Us The Toys That Made Us is here ♪
translation.ko: 토이 - 우리가 사랑한 장난감들이에요 토이 - 우리가 사랑한 장난감들이 여기 있네요 "닌자 거북이"

translation.en: [DB] They're mutants.
They're ninjas.
They're teenagers.
And they're turtles.
But this story starts with a different kind of shelled mutant.
translation.ko: 하지만 이 이야기는 다른 딱지를 가진 돌연변이체와 함께 시작되죠

translation.en: Lobsters.
And now, here is that story.
[Kevin] I grew up in a very small town in Maine.
I used to work cooking lobsters.
[DB] But Kevin Eastman had no appetite for shellfish.
translation.ko: 하지만 케빈 이스트먼은 갑각류를 좋아하지 않았죠

translation.en: Bottom feeders. Anything that goes to the bottom, they eat it.
translation.ko: 걔들은 바닥에 살며 아무거나 주워 먹잖아요

translation.en: [DB] He consumed something else. [Kevin] I ate, slept, breathed comic books.
translation.ko: - 케빈은 다른 걸 섭취했죠 - 전 만화책을 먹고 살았어요

translation.en: Daredevil, Captain America, Batman.
But my favorite was Kamandi, The Last Boy on Earth,
translation.ko: 제일 좋아한 건 '카만디 - 지구의 마지막 소년'이었죠

translation.en: drawn by my hero, a guy named Jack Kirby.
translation.ko: 제 영웅 잭 커비가 그린 거였는데

translation.en: He did Iron Man, and Hulk, and The Fantastic Four.
Jack Kirby is the artist's artist.
He created what we know as comic book art today.
translation.ko: 오늘날의 만화 예술은 그가 창조한 거라고 할 수 있어요

translation.en: He broke the mold and changed things.
[DB] Including the career path of a young Kevin Eastman.
[KE] I told my parents, "I wanna be Jack Kirby when I grow up,
translation.ko: 전 부모님께 이랬죠 '잭 커비 같은 사람이 될래요'

translation.en: I wanna be a comic book storyteller."
And they just had this absolute mortified look.
My dad said, "I'll help you with money for college,
for any school except art school." [laughs]
[DB] Dejected, Kevin hit the road, chasing his dreams.
translation.ko: 낙담한 케빈은 꿈을 좇아 길을 나섰습니다

translation.en: It was a girl, yeah. You know?
[laughs] Women! [DB] Ending up in Dover, New Hampshire,
translation.ko: 여자를 좇아서! 뉴햄프셔주 도버로 가게 됐죠

translation.en: where Kevin would start a new relationship
with this guy, which is good news for us.
My name is Peter Laird.
I had a gig with the local newspaper, the Daily Hampshire Gazette.
translation.ko: '데일리 햄프셔 가제트'란 지역 신문에서 일하고 있었는데

translation.en: It didn't pay that great and I had to draw all these things
translation.ko: 원고료도 적었고 흥미 없는 것들을 그려야 했어요

translation.en: that I had no interest in drawing,
like tomato plants and vegetables.
[DB] As Peter was drawing them, Kevin was packing them.
translation.ko: 피터가 그런 걸 그릴 때 케빈은 그런 걸 포장하고 있었죠

translation.en: I was working, bagging groceries.
[DB] But the fruit and vegetable aisle of destiny
had plans for these struggling artists, who decided to hang out.
translation.ko: 서로 어울리기로 한 이 둘을 위한 계획이 있었죠

translation.en: And I invited him over to my house.
The first thing I saw when I went through the door was a Jack Kirby original.
translation.ko: 문을 열고 들어가자 잭 커비의 원화가 있었어요

translation.en: And I almost passed out.
I had never seen a Jack Kirby original in my life.
translation.ko: 그의 원화를 본 건 생애 처음이었거든요

translation.en: It just blew my mind, the power of his drawing
translation.ko: 그림에서 느껴지는 힘이 저를 완전히 사로잡았어요

translation.en: in Fantastic Four and Thor, and The New Gods, Mister Miracle.
It was like talking to someone with a completely like mind.
translation.ko: 이야기해보니 저와 맘이 너무 잘 맞더군요

translation.en: [Peter] That spark was wonderful. I'd never had that with anybody,
before or since.
It was love at first sight.
[DB] Like a comic-book cupid, Jack Kirby had forged a bond...
translation.ko: 잭커비는 만화책 큐피드처럼 두 사람의 인연을 맺어줬습니다

translation.en: I'll ink his pencils and he'll ink mine.
translation.ko: 우린 서로의 연필 선에 잉크 칠을 해주곤 했어요

translation.en: [DB] ...between a young Eastman and Laird,
who moved in together
and fulfilled their dream of owning a comic book studio.
Mirage Studios.
[KE] That was our joke, Mirage was formed
translation.ko: 그 이름은 농담이에요 스튜디오가 아니라 우리 집 거실이었거든요

translation.en: not in a studio, but our living room.
"Studio."
[DB] With a fake-it-till-you-make-it business model,
these maestros of mirage began polishing their portfolios.
translation.ko: 이 신기루의 거장들은 포트폴리오를 치장하기 시작했죠

translation.en: We came up with this idea for this robot called the "Fugitoid."
I think we sent to like four or five different comic-book companies.
Spent a lot of money on postage.
And those companies spent a lot on postage, too,
sending us rejection letters.
That was fun.
[DB] It was starting to look like Eastman and Laird's dream of comic-book greatness
would vanish like a mirage.
But then, late one night...
We were in our living room that we pretended was a studio.
translation.ko: 우린 거실에 앉아 스튜디오에 있는 척하고 있었죠

translation.en: We were being silly and he had the idea
that he was gonna draw something to make me laugh...
-and he drew this turtle. -[KE] He had a mask on. He had nun-chucks.
translation.ko: - 거북이를 그리더군요 - 복면을 쓰고 쌍절곤을 든 거북요

translation.en: I loved it and I drew my own version.
translation.ko: 아주 마음에 들어서 제 버전으로 그려봤죠

translation.en: Then it made me laugh, ha ha.
Then I said, "Well, if one, why not a group?"
-I inked it using a magic marker. -I penciled in this "ninja turtle" logo.
translation.ko: 전 매직 마커로 잉크 칠을 했어요 전 연필로 '닌자 거북이' 로고를 그렸죠

translation.en: [Peter] I added the "teenage mutant" to it.
[DB] And with that, Eastman and Laird stumbled upon an idea
translation.ko: 그렇게 우연히 이스트먼과 레어드는 사람들 귀에 딱지가 앉게 회자될 만화에 대한 아이디어를 발견했죠

translation.en: that would send the world into shell shock.
translation.ko: 사람들 귀에 딱지가 앉게 회자될 만화에 대한 아이디어를 발견했죠

translation.en: Well, eventually.
After further developing the characters and story,
translation.ko: 이스트먼과 레어드는 제한된 자원으로 캐릭터와 스토리를 심화한 후

translation.en: with limited resources,
translation.ko: 제한된 자원으로 캐릭터와 스토리를 심화한 후

translation.en: Eastman and Laird self-published their very first issue.
translation.ko: 자신들의 첫 번째 만화책을 자비로 출판했습니다

translation.en: [Peter] 3,275 copies.
[DB] Oh, and how did it go?
I remember Pete calling up really excited, he said:
That first printing sold out within days.
We got pre-orders for 15,000 copies of the second issue.
You know, double take.
[KE] I quit any other job I had.
We started working full-time drawing comic books.
I had become Jack Kirby, in my mind.
And to me, that's when the dream came true. Period.
[DB] Word was spreading about this gritty independent comic.
translation.ko: 이 거칠고 사실적인 독립 만화에 관한 소문이 퍼졌죠

translation.en: When I first saw Turtles, it really struck me,
because it was just really bold.
You know, they lived in the sewers,
and they just had that dark and gritty feel to it.
Those four words, "teenage," "mutant," "ninja," "turtles,"
translation.ko: 십대, 돌연변이, 닌자 거북이라는 네 단어가

translation.en: you're like, "I've never heard of all that together.
translation.ko: 같이 묶인 건 생전 처음 봤죠

translation.en: That's clever, I think." It catches your attention.
[Peter] Issue eight sold a 135,000 copies.
When it suddenly dawned on me,
I was making more than my wife was, teaching,
translation.ko: 제가 교사인 아내보다 더 많은 돈을 벌고 있단 걸요

translation.en: doing my stupid comic book with my friend Kevin.
translation.ko: 친구 케빈과 함께 바보 같은 만화를 그려서요

translation.en: [DB] Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles was a bona fide hit,
at least in comic circles. But all that was about to change.
translation.ko: 적어도 만화광들 사이에선요 하지만 그것도 곧 바뀔 참이었죠

translation.en: But we were then getting nibbles here and there for licensing.
translation.ko: 여기 저기에서 라이선싱에 관한 문의가 들어왔죠

translation.en: One of those nibblers was Mark Freedman.
translation.ko: 마크 프리드먼도 문의한 사람 중 하나죠

translation.en: I think I'm the man behind the Turtles. I might even be the fifth Turtle.
translation.ko: 저도 '닌자 거북이'를 만드는 데 기여했어요 제가 다섯 번째 거북이일지도요

translation.en: [DB] A renaissance man of sorts,
Mark-elangelo was on the lookout for a masterpiece.
Mark Freedman was merely a freelance agent,
translation.ko: 마크 프리드먼은 여러 지적 저작권 계약에서

translation.en: representing intellectual properties for different deals.
[Mark] I was looking for an emerging IP
translation.ko: 전 장난감 회사에 라이선싱을 할 만한

translation.en: that I could take and potentially license to a toy industry.
[DB] Approaching the hottest duo in underground comics,
translation.ko: 언더그라운드 만화계에서 가장 주목 받고 있는 듀오인

translation.en: to Eastman and Laird, Freedman was the real deal.
translation.ko: 이스트먼과 레어드에게 프리드먼의 접근은 아주 큰 사건이었습니다

translation.en: I didn't have a company.
All I had was a business card, and I worked out of an apartment,
and I said, "I've got to make a good impression."
Rent a suit and a shirt with a power tie.
translation.ko: 정장과 셔츠 강해 보이는 넥타이를 빌렸죠

translation.en: Kevin and I were in T-shirts and shorts,
and Mark shows up and he's in his three-piece power suit.
translation.ko: 마크가 쓰리 피스 파워 슈트를 입고 찾아왔어요

translation.en: If this is what an agent is supposed to look like,
I'll play the part.
[DB] A skeptical Eastman and Laird listened
as the polyester pitchman laid out his plan.
translation.ko: 잘 차려입은 외판원이 구상한 계획을 들었습니다

translation.en: I said, "Listen, I wanna be your global licensing agent,
translation.ko: '두 분의 국제 라이선싱 에이전트가 되고 싶어요'

translation.en: and this is about building a franchise
that could live in toys and live in entertainment,"
and my mind was just wild with ideas.
Well...
[DB] But for Eastman and Laird there was one important deal-breaker.
translation.ko: 하지만 이스트먼과 레어드에겐 양보할 수 없는 조건이 있었습니다

translation.en: We said, "If you are going out there to talk to people about our characters,
translation.ko: 당신이 사람들한테 우리 캐릭터를 팔려고 한다면

translation.en: we want them to understand that we will have final say. We will have full control.
translation.ko: 우리가 최종 결정권을 쥐는 조건으로만 계약할 거라고 했죠

translation.en: -Okay. -[KE] It was three guys
that had a handshake deal. We had a clear understanding.
You know, it seemed like, why not?
[Mark] Now I have to go into the marketplace
translation.ko: 전 이제 시장에 나가 회사들을 설득해야 했죠

translation.en: and convince some company to take the chance.
translation.ko: 전 이제 시장에 나가 회사들을 설득해야 했죠 이 기회를 잡으라고요

translation.en: I needed assets for presentation purposes and they had a foam rubber turtle.
translation.ko: 발표를 위한 소품이 필요했는데 두 사람한텐 발포 고무로 만든 거북이가 있었죠

translation.en: I need it. So the turtle sat in the passenger seat of the car,
translation.ko: 전 그게 필요했어요 그래서 거북이를 조수석에 태웠죠

translation.en: and as I'm driving to New York, people were honking...
translation.ko: 뉴욕으로 가는 길에 사람들이 경적을 울리며...

translation.en: [man's voice] Hey, turtle guy!
[Mark] ...and looking and cracking up.
And I knew this was gonna be good.
I think his initial responses were kind of disappointing.
translation.ko: 마크가 처음에 얻은 반응은 솔직히 조금 실망스러웠어요

translation.en: People would say to me, "Turtles aren't heroic. Forget about it.
And by the way, green will not sell."
You know, what do you say to that?
Even the word "ninja"... The definition was "hired assassin."
How am I building a kid's toy line based on hired assassins?
I went to a company called LJN.
Jack Friedman, who ran the company, said, "Thanks, but no thanks."
I was turned down by Jill Barad, the CEO of Mattel,
translation.ko: 마텔의 CEO 질 바러드도 라이선싱 제안을 거절했어요

translation.en: saying they'd never work.
So, lots of naysayers.
[DB] But Hasbro's Kirk Bozigian had a different response.
translation.ko: 하지만 해즈브로의 커크 보지기언의 답변은 달랐습니다

translation.en: I think it's kind of cool.
[DB] So he took it upstairs.
My boss looks at me and says,
"That's the dumbest idea I've ever seen."
So that was my involvement with Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.
[DB] But Freedman and his rented suit wouldn't be deterred.
translation.ko: 하지만 대여 정장을 입은 프리드먼은 단념하지 않았죠

translation.en: I've got to convince the world that this is a great idea.
translation.ko: 전 이게 히트할 거라고 세상을 설득해야 했습니다

translation.en: So I called up a friend of mine,
Richard Sallis, who just took a job with a company called Playmates Toys.
translation.ko: '플레이메이츠 토이즈'란 회사에 막 취직한 리처드 샐리스한테요

translation.en: They were my last resort.
Probably the only resort.
When I said, "I'm going to send you a giant replica," he said, "Okay."
translation.ko: 큰 모형을 보내주겠다고 하니 그 친구는 알았다고 대답했어요

translation.en: So the next day I said, "Richard, did you get the box?"
translation.ko: 전 다음 날 물어봤죠 '리처드, 상자 받았어?'

translation.en: He says, "Yeah, it's sitting in my office."
I said, "Why didn't you open it?"
"Oh, I've been busy with this and that." I said, "Richard, open the [bleep] box!"
He opens it up.
He gets very quiet.
And he says,
"This is great."
I called up Peter and Kevin, and I said...
translation.ko: 전 피터와 케빈에게 전화로 이렇게 말했죠

translation.en: "Now I got this Playmates toy company interested."
translation.ko: '플레이메이츠 장난감 회사가 여러분 캐릭터에 관심을 보였어요'

translation.en: -I'd never heard of them before. -[DB] You might not have heard of them,
translation.ko: - 그런 회사가 있는지도 몰랐어요 - 그 회사 이름을 못 들어봤더라도

translation.en: but if you owned a doll in the early '80s,
there's a good chance you've played with a Playmate's toy.
translation.ko: 플레이메이츠의 장난감을 갖고 놀았을 확률이 큽니다

translation.en: [male voiceover] Based and started in Hong Kong,
Playmates has been the largest doll manufacturer in Hong Kong
translation.ko: 지금까지도 홍콩에서 가장 큰 인형 제조사입니다

translation.en: for many years.
[DB] And the man responsible for this baby boom is here.
translation.ko: 이 베이비 붐을 일으킨 사람은 이 남자죠

translation.en: My name is Thomas Chan.
I worked for the company for 50 years.
[DB] Turning his father's manufacturing factory toy-wards in 1966...
translation.ko: 1966년 아버지의 공장에서 장난감을 제조하기 시작한 후...

translation.en: Business started to grow tremendously.
[DB] ...Thomas grew Playmates into a major Hong Kong player.
translation.ko: 토머스는 플레이메이츠를 홍콩의 주요 기업으로 키웠죠

translation.en: I decided to diversify into preschool toys.
translation.ko: 전 유아용 장난감으로 사업을 다각화하기로 했죠

translation.en: [DB] But this toy king of the East had his sights set westward.
translation.ko: 이 동방의 장난감 왕은 서진을 꿈꾸고 있었습니다

translation.en: The biggies.
Mattel, Hasbro, Ideal Toys...
into their business, into the United States.
[DB] So to help him take his first steps in the US market,
translation.ko: 아장아장 걷는 아이들과 미국 시장에 첫걸음을 디디려는

translation.en: in waddled this American.
Thomas Chan said, "Help us build this US operation."
translation.ko: 챈은 제게 미국 지사를 세우는 걸 도와달라고 했죠

translation.en: -[DB] So he did, with... -Cricket.
translation.ko: - 그래서 그는 이 카드를 꺼냈죠 - 크리켓

translation.en: [commentator] Bowling.
-No. -Cricket.
No, a Cricket doll.
Hi, Cricket!
This super-intelligent interactive doll.

I'll be talking to ya!
In the US, we sold a million pieces, and the retail was over 100 dollars.

Playmates thought, "This is golden"...
...and decided to follow it up with "Jill."
[Bill Carson] Much larger, more expensive and very complicated.

translation.en: I think it's a failure.
[DB] But, not ready to hoist the white flag just yet...
translation.ko: 하지만 플레이메이츠는 백기를 들 생각이 없었죠

translation.en: It's a failure.
[DB] ...Playmates persisted.
We got to come up with something that's easier to produce

translation.en: than sophisticated dolls.
We were ready to try something different,

translation.en: "Richard, open the [bleep] box!"
And he went to the president of Playmates at the time, Bill Carlson.

"I think we ought to look at this, boss."
And I said, "Let's look."
[DB] And once the cardboard turtle-filled Pandora's box was open...

translation.en: [DB] ...Mark Freedman soon closed the deal.
I ended it up negotiating a deal for $150,000.
[DB] Not only that...
We had full approval rights over all of the creative decisions
translation.ko: 모든 의사 결정을 승인할 권한을 갖게 됐죠 창작과 제품 개발에 관해서요

translation.ko: 상황을 요약하면 당시 우리 회사 사람들은

The biggies.

How do we take these somewhat violent characters

We killed the bad guy in the first issue.

[DB] But Shredder wouldn't be working alone.
This is Rocksteady, in the original form.
And this was Bebop.

Upchucky. You'd put food into his mouth,

-No. -[DB] And that was this guy's problem.
translation.ko: - 안 돼요 - 그건 칼이 해결할 문제였습니다

translation.en: It's very hard to launch an action figure line

translation.en: ...to make them a cartoon designed specifically to sell toys.

[DB] This wise guy...

-[DB] Leonardo. -[DW] The straight arrow,

The sarcastic smartass.

Pizza time!
Let's have the Turtles love pizza.

translation.en: Really, there's a turtle for every kid.

-Who wants cornflakes? -I'm having raisin bran.

The Turtles' mutation into action figures was almost complete.

I wasn't thinking that way when I was sculpting it.
translation.ko: 조각할 때는 그런 생각이 안 들었어요

we decided to give him a... [snips]
A real pain in the tail.

No.

We had missed the mark. The humor was not coming across.

translation.en: -Where does the Turtles' cat sleep? -In the mew-tent.

No.
We need vehicles for these guys, but our Chinese parent said...

translation.en: -No. -"Not until we know
you're gonna really sell some."
They weren't sure...
...how to market this product.

TV show, 1.5 million.
The design already done,
so if we cut the loss,
that means it's totally lost.
So there was no going back at that point.

I'm a toy designer.

-[DB] Along with this guy. -Bong.

...that I be brought in to work on the Turtle line,

translation.en: 'cause it wasn't going anywhere, with all respect for John.
Okay.
And so...
So I left, went back to Mattel.
[DB] And Mark got to work.
[MT] They had sketches stacked up three feet high,

translation.en: [DB] And Mark knew something about kicking butt.

[DB] So now that he had the power at Playmates,

He-Man style.

"We're really hip."

translation.en: ♪ They're heroes in a half shell and they're green ♪
"Hey, get a grip!"
♪ Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles ♪
-"Heroes in a half shell." -"Turtle power." Hey!

translation.en: Literature.
[DB] Chuck Lorre's infectious jingle...
Thank you, Chuck.

-Me, of course. -[DB] Geoffrey the Giraffe?
[Karl] Toys "R" Us was known as the retailer that would support everything.

Wow.

translation.ko: 비밥과 록스테디 일회용 악당 군인인 풋 클랜도 완성됐어요

♪ Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles ♪
[voiceover] From Playmates!

translation.en: what in the world is that?"
Those ten action figures, released in the first wave, are so iconic.
translation.ko: 첫 번째로 발매된 10종의 액션 피겨는 아주 독특했죠

translation.en: There's a certain whimsy to them that isn't obvious in any other major action figure line of that time.

Cowabunga, dudes!
[DB] The Turtles had gone from underground oddity

[commentator] The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

translation.en: [DB] Taking Playmates along for the ride,

Those cost us about one million dollars. [laughs]
[DB] But the newest biggie on the block

They were big checks. [laughs]
That first big check, which I think was a little over a million dollars...
translation.ko: 처음 받은 저작권료는 100만 달러가 조금 넘었어요

"When you get money, save it and invest it, or put it away."
Did Kevin tell you one of the first things he bought was a tank?
translation.ko: 케빈이 제일 먼저 산 게 전차였단 거 들으셨어요?

translation.en: [KE] An M15A Stuart light tank.
We used to have big paintball wars. I'd just hide in my tank and...

translation.en: [DB] While Eastman took cover in his half shell,
translation.ko: 이스트먼이 철로 만든 딱지 속에 숨었을 때

translation.en: Mark Freedman was launching an offensive
on an entirely different front.
I wanted to offer the fans something bigger and better.
translation.ko: 전 팬들에게 더 크고 멋진 걸 주고 싶었죠

translation.en: I wanted to do a live action feature film.
-[DB] Great idea! -[cheering]
-[DB] Or not. -[boos]
We've seen a lot of movies
where comic book characters are taken into live action,

[DB] The idea ruffled Playmates' feathers too.
They felt I was rocking the boat. We already have a successful TV series.
translation.ko: 긁어 부스럼 만들지 말랬죠 이미 애니메이션이 성공했고

translation.en: But I know from business, if you sit still, you die.

translation.en: You have to go forward.
[DB] Mark Freedman moved his idea forward, to Golden Harvest Pictures.
translation.ko: 그래서 마크 프리드먼은 '골든 하베스트 픽처스'로 갔죠

translation.en: We have the best stunt guys in the world.
All we have to do is put four guys in our stunt suits.
translation.ko: 우린 그중 네 명한테 거북이 옷을 입히면 됐어요

translation.en: Awesome!
And also, I have Jim Henson.
-[DB] The maestro of Muppets himself? -Yeah.
-Cowabunga! -[bell rings]
[DB] It was starting to look like Mark's idea would work out after all.
translation.ko: 이제 마크의 아이디어가 성공할 것처럼 보이기 시작했죠

translation.en: Yeah, well so far, my track record's been batting a thousand.
translation.ko: 네, 그때까진 아주 잘 되고 있었어요

translation.en: [DB] And sure enough, he'd get his chance
to make the naysayers at Playmates eat crow-topped pizza.
translation.ko: 한 방 먹일 기회도 곧 올 것 같았습니다

translation.en: The movie gets completed

translation.ko: 리처드 샐리스가 제게 와서 이러더군요 예의 바르게 절 쳐다보면서요

translation.en: "Well, you [bleep] that up, Freedman."
We thought we were in trouble.
The TV show was very light-hearted and bright. This was...
translation.ko: TV 애니메이션은 아주 가볍고 밝았는데 이건...

translation.en: ...the polar opposite.
[MF] Of course, when I walked out, I said, "Holy [bleep], what did I just do?"
translation.ko: 전 나오면서 이랬죠 '젠장, 내가 뭘 한 거지?'

translation.en: There goes the property.
[DB] Things were looking dark
when Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles hit theaters in March of 1990.
translation.ko: 1990년 3월 '닌자 거북이'가 극장을 찾았을 때 상황은 암울해 보였죠

translation.en: [MF] Needless to say, the film opened up and...
translation.ko: 말할 것도 없지만 그 영화는 개봉 후...

translation.en: it broke all records.
Cowabunga!
We ended up at $134 million.
The biggest indie film of all time at that point.
translation.ko: 당시 역대 최고로 흥행한 독립 영화였죠 "꾸준한 거북이가 흥행한다"

translation.en: I now call up Playmates.
I said, "How're the toy sales this weekend, guys?"
translation.ko: 이렇게 말했어요 '이번 주말 장난감 판매량은 어땠어요?'

translation.en: No Turtle on the shelf.
Sold out. Everywhere.
Oops!
[DB] With Ninja Turtles: The Movie breaking box office records,
translation.ko: '닌자 거북이' 영화가 박스 오피스 기록을 깰 때

translation.en: Playmates' profits continued to mutate.
-We sold 100 million units just in 1990. -[cash register rings]
We owned 80% of the boys' space.
Everyday is Christmas sales.
[DB] Kids were Casey Jones-ing for more.
[TV] Casey Jones, the sports warrior!
[DB] And if Playmates wanted to meet the demand,
they'd have to use their brains.
We have to have a new character every month.
translation.ko: 우린 매달 새 캐릭터를 출시해야 했죠

translation.en: [TV] Introducing Leatherhead!
There was a guy who we decided to call Pizza Face.
translation.ko: 그때 만든 캐릭터 중엔 피자 페이스란 남자도 있었죠

translation.en: New.
[Scott] And also Ray Fillet.
[Scott] General Traag.
New.
[Scott] Mutagen Man.
And we did a giant mosquito.
Yeah, they were going by pretty fast.
[DB] But if you're one of those thinking...
I've always been a play set guy.
[DB] ...Playmates didn't leave you hanging. In fact...
There were two major play sets.
The sewer play set was the headquarters for the Turtles and Splinter.
translation.ko: 하수구 플레이 세트는 거북이들과 스플린터의 본부였어요

translation.en: It was dual tiered so you could have a street-level play set
and an underground play set. Unbelievable.
translation.ko: 하나는 지하층이었죠 믿을 수 없이 멋졌어요

translation.en: And then the Technodrome was the villain's play set.
It was this big, huge ball with an eye mounted on top on tank treads.
translation.ko: 꼭대기에 눈이 달렸고 전차 바퀴를 가진 큰 구였죠

translation.en: And it would unfold and open up with a jail in the middle.
translation.ko: 그 구를 열면 가운데에 감옥이 있었어요

translation.en: When I saw it the first time, I thought...
"I'm gonna buy that [bleep] thing."
[DB] But that didn't mean the Turtles themselves got crowded out of the party.
translation.ko: 그렇다고 거북이들이 주연 자리를 뺏긴 건 아닙니다

translation.en: As we started expanding the Turtle line, instead of just four naked turtles,
translation.ko: 우린 제품군을 확장하면서 벌거벗은 거북이 네 마리 대신

translation.en: we started integrating different themes.
Sports, samurai,
-space. -[TV voiceover] T minus ten.
It's one of the biggest toy lines ever,
mainly because they just kept releasing the same four figures
with different outfits.
So we'll have Hip-hop Turtle, and monster Turtles.
translation.ko: 힙합 거북이도 만들고 괴물 거북이도 만들고

translation.en: Backflip Turtles.
They even had Turtle Trolls.
I loved those. I mean, they were so ugly, they were cute.
I hated them.
Star Trek Turtles... I think Donatello had Vulcan ears.
translation.ko: 스타트렉 거북이 도나텔로한테 벌컨족 귀가 있었죠

translation.en: Caveman Turtles, Western Turtles.
The transforming Turtle,
that goes from pet turtle to Ninja Turtle.
Caveman Turtle. What about, you know, Western Turtle?
translation.ko: 원시인 거북이 서부 시대 거북이도 있었죠

translation.en: Wait, I just said-- I said--
-Whatever. -The whole point is, yeah.
I can't keep track of this.
[DB] Well then, we'd better move on to movie Turtles.
Wait, Playmates didn't make any?
Not for the first movie. -[DB] Why not? -Um...
Because they weren't interested in supporting such a violent film.
translation.ko: 그렇게 폭력적인 영화를 지원하는 데엔 흥미가 없었죠

translation.en: [DB] Oh yeah. Well maybe they should come up with a new movie.
We came up with a story, "The Secret of the Ooze."
We quickly put a product line together for the second movie,
translation.ko: 우린 두 번째 영화를 위한 제품군을 서둘러 만들었고

translation.en: and that did gangbusters.
-Hold up! -Where is the Vanilla Ice action figure?
-That's what I wanna know. -[DB] Don't worry. Here he is!
translation.ko: 액션 피겨는 어디 있어요? 걱정 마세요, 여기 있어요

translation.en: ♪ Go ninja, go ninja, go ♪
Go ninja, go ninja, go!
That song never gets old.
♪ Go, go, go, go ♪
[DB] But things were starting to get old, by the third Turtle film, two years later.
translation.ko: 하지만 2년 후 세 번째 영화가 개봉할 때쯤 사람들은 지겨워하기 시작했죠

translation.en: Oh, boy. What's the name of that one?
We said, "Maybe we should stop now, and let it dry out."
translation.ko: 이젠 관두고 인기가 식게 놔두어야 할 때라고 생각했죠

translation.en: [DB] But it wasn't just the movies drying out.
The show ratings eventually declined.
Toy sales eventually declined.
One third of business by '96.
[DB] With Turtles on a downward slide, it was time for reflection.
translation.ko: 거북이들의 인기는 하향세였고 회사는 미래를 생각해야 했습니다

translation.en: It was time for hard decisions.
It was time for a reboot.
There had been discussions about, "Wouldn't it be great to do a live action TV series?"
translation.ko: 이런 얘기가 오갔죠 '실사 TV 시리즈를 하면 어떨까?'

translation.en: [DB] And why not?
The Fox Network had some pretty good luck with Haim Saban's Power Rangers.
translation.ko: 마침 폭스가 하임 사반의 '파워레인저'로 대박을 터뜨렸고요

translation.en: You want me to send you the ratings?
Saban's company, because he was doing the Power Rangers, had the ability
to do the live action Turtle show.
translation.ko: '닌자 거북이' 실사 시리즈를 제작할 능력이 있었죠

translation.en: [DB] So Haim got to work,
enlisting the aid of Fox Kids exec, Margareth Loesh.
translation.ko: 폭스 키즈의 경영자 마거릿 뢰시의 도움을 받아서요

translation.en: She wanted to do something different
and she wanted to introduce a "female turtle."
I have no recollection of that.
My bet is, it was a toy company request.
translation.ko: 아마 장난감 회사에서 그런 요청이 들어왔을 거예요

translation.en: Remember, Power Rangers had been very successful,
and had two girl characters who were very popular
and did bring girl appeal into the show.
translation.ko: 그 덕에 여자아이들도 그 시리즈를 좋아하게 됐죠

translation.en: Let us help you.
I think that's what they probably wanted.
[DB] But, like with everything else,
Eastman and Laird would have to sign off on the lady turtle idea.
translation.ko: 먼저, 이스트먼과 레어드가 여자 거북이를 허락해야 했죠

translation.en: I said, "Yeah, well, it's not...
what we originally envisioned,
but I can see that and I think it'd be great.
[DB] That's one down. As for Peter...
translation.ko: 한 명은 허락했네요 - 그리고 피터는... - 절대 안 돼요!

translation.en: No way! There's four Turtles.
translation.ko: - 그리고 피터는... - 절대 안 돼요! 거북이는 네 마리예요

translation.en: There's Leonardo, Michelangelo, Raphael, and Donatello. That's it.
translation.ko: 레오나르도, 미켈란젤로 라파엘, 도나텔로, 그게 다죠

translation.en: -I might even be the fifth Turtle. -[DB] Not this time, Mark.
translation.ko: - 제가 다섯 번째 거북이일지도요 - 이번엔 아니에요, 마크

translation.en: Without Laird's blessing, the new show would be dead in the water.
translation.ko: 레어드의 허락이 없으면 새 시리즈는 실패할 게 뻔했죠

translation.en: You know, we're either going to continue to extend the Turtle license
translation.ko: 우리의 선택지는 둘이었죠 라이선스 계약을 연장하거나 미래의 소득을 포기하거나였는데

translation.en: or we don't have income coming in.
translation.ko: 라이선스 계약을 연장하거나 미래의 소득을 포기하거나였는데

translation.en: It was the biggest disagreement we'd ever had
on the management of the Turtles and what to do with the Turtles,
translation.ko: 이렇게 의견이 완전히 달랐던 건 처음이었어요

translation.en: Eventually Laird would cave in, but only under one condition.
He said, "I don't want anything to do with it, but you oversee it,"
translation.ko: '난 그런 일에 관여하기 싫어' '네가 잘 감독해'라고 하면서...

translation.en: and then he kind of like... stepped away.
It was something I really couldn't deal with.
translation.ko: 그 설정을 도저히 받아들일 수 없었어요

translation.en: [DB] And as it turned out, kids couldn't deal with it either.
translation.ko: 결과적으로, 아이들도 그걸 받아들일 수 없었죠

translation.en: The Saban show did not work.
The fans hated it.
A girl turtle?
It was nothing about gender, I just don't think it was...
translation.ko: 성 문제가 아니었어요 그런 것 때문이 아니라...

translation.en: It was hard to... It was too forced.
You and I are just mutant boy and mutant girl.
translation.ko: 우린 그냥 돌연변이 남자애와 여자애일 뿐이잖아

translation.en: No relation.
[Margaret] I don't want to blame anybody.
It was certainly my decision to greenlight it.
You know, you win some and you lose some.
translation.ko: 이길 때도 있고 질 때도 있는 거죠

translation.en: [DB] But some lost more than others.
translation.ko: 하지만 남들보다 많이 잃은 사람도 있죠

translation.en: [Peter] Almost from day one,
when the Turtles started to become popular,
there had been this suggestion from fans,
"Why don't you add a fifth Turtle?"
But we both always expressed the opinion that we thought it was a stupid idea.
translation.ko: 우리 둘은 항상 그게 멍청한 생각이라고 얘기했죠

translation.en: So when the time came that Kevin was for it,
it seemed like in some ways a betrayal of an idea that we had both shared.
translation.ko: 우리가 공유한 아이디어 대한 배신처럼 느껴졌어요

translation.en: I think it was indicative of exactly how far he and I had diverged.
translation.ko: 그건 우리 사이가 얼마나 멀어졌는지 보여주는 지표였죠

translation.en: It was an evolution.
No quality time, brotherhood time, bonding time, only business time.
translation.ko: 형제처럼 친하게 지냈었지만 나중엔 사업 문제로만 만났죠

translation.en: We just didn't hang out and I think that bond was lost.
translation.ko: 같이 놀지 않았어요 전처럼 친하지 않았죠

translation.en: [DB] As the Mirage Comics bond dissolved,
so too did Kevin Eastman's enthusiasm for Ninja Turtles.
translation.ko: '닌자 거북이'에 대한 케빈 이스트먼의 열정도 사라졌죠

translation.en: I think the Turtles were something that had been great
translation.ko: '닌자 거북이'는 케빈에게 한동안 큰 즐거움을 줬지만

translation.en: and wonderful for him for a while,
but he wanted to move on to other things.
So I was happy to let it go, to...
another corporation or whatever.
And Pete was adamant, "I'll never sell my rights to the Turtles."
translation.ko: 피터는 단호했죠 '난 내 저작권을 절대 팔지 않을 거야'

translation.en: And so we worked out a deal where he bought out my remaining share.
translation.ko: 그래서 피터가 제 지분을 인수하는 계약을 맺었어요

translation.en: [DB] After almost 20 years,
the once inseparable roommates, partners, and friends
translation.ko: 불가분의 룸메이트이자 파트너, 친구였던 두 사람이

translation.en: parted ways for good.
I wish things had been different.
I wish we had remained as tight as we had been in the early days.
translation.ko: 예전처럼 친한 사이로 계속 남았다면 말이에요

translation.en: [DB] With Kevin and Peter's girl troubles over,
translation.ko: 여자 거북이를 둘러싼 케빈과 피터의 갈등이 끝나자

translation.en: Peter took the Turtles back to the sewer, so to speak.
translation.ko: 피터는 거북이들을 다시 하수구로 불러들였죠 말하자면요

translation.en: A little darker, a little edgier.
[DB] And a little more profitable.
Show me the money, baby! Woo-hoo!
We did a lot of toys.
[TV] New extreme Turtles, with extreme weapons...
translation.ko: 더 멋진 거북이들과 더 멋진 무기, 차량...

translation.en: Turtles always has this huge drive up
and then it will eventually come down.
[DB] But by 2009 it was feeling like the Turtles were skating by on their name,
translation.ko: 하지만 2009년엔 거북이들이 이름에 기대어 순항하는 듯했죠

translation.en: or at least their initials.
The Turtles at that time had kind of crested a wave of popularity.
[DB] The Turtles were once again ripe for a fresh facelift.
translation.ko: 거북이들이 주름 제거 수술을 또 한 번 받아야 할 때가 됐습니다

translation.en: Luckily, an all-new character was about to arrive in the nick of time.
translation.ko: 다행히, 새 캐릭터가 아슬아슬하게 적시에 도착했죠

translation.en: "A female turtle."
No way!
-[DB] Just kidding! -Okay.
[DB] It was a multinational media conglomerate, of course.
translation.ko: 그 캐릭터는 물론 다국적 미디어 기업이었죠

translation.en: I was approached by Viacom,
and they said, "Hey, we'd like to think about purchasing the Turtles."
[DB] Which made sense,
because while Viacom subsidiary Nickelodeon was saturated
with sponges and Doras,
they were doing a bit of exploring of their own.
We really didn't have that iconic action figure show.
translation.ko: 우리에겐 인상적인 액션 피겨 시리즈가 없었죠

translation.en: [DB] Which is exactly what Peter Laird was sitting on.
-Yeah. -There was just one problem.
He said he will never sell it.
